message: maybe because it's called compare view
Yeah, I'll second this, it's an amazing view, but it takes me 5 mins to figure it out each time
this thing: https://github.com/blog/612-introducing-github-compare-view
i guess you're supposed to go to Source → Branch List, but i only ever want it between arbitrary commits anyway
so i guess i need to remember it's called “compare view” so i can write the /compare/left...right url manually
ugh, i can never remember how to get into diff view

for some reason i thought you could click the “Tree: <hash>” in the tab nav and get a dialog for selecting, but i was thinking of the box you get when you're already in compare view and click one of the refs
Yeah, a quick info box somewhere would really be nice -- or a small popup where you can enter repo and ref details..
I think I once tweeted this to github's twitter account, they sayed I should file a bug, but I never did this. Maybe they improve if we nudge them.
@markpasc yes this one is usable, but not helpful if you don't know how to get there :)
